question: Which among the following is the “legally binding” convention?
option1: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
option2: Asia-Pacific Partnership on Clean Development and Climate
option3: Vienna Convention for the Protection of the Ozone Layer
option4: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification
answer: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification
explanation: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) was established in 1994, and at present has 197 parties working towards maintaining and restoring land and soil productivity as well as mitigating effects of drought. It is the only legally binding international agreement that links environment and development issues to land agenda.
